trigger.name: BC_ Click - Link - External
trigger.notes: This trigger will target "external" link clicks. This may need to be configured for your website depending on where it is hosted. For example if your domain is a sub domain then other sub-domains maybe considered "external". You can use "external|subdomain" in this situation. Otherwise re-work this trigger to correctly track your external links if required.

variable.name: BC_ Const - UA - ID - Prod - Config
variable.notes:
Your Google Analytics Property ID e.g. UA-xxxxxxxxx-x 
https://support.google.com/tagmanager/answer/9207621#ga_id

variable.name: BC_ Const - UA - ID - UAT - Config
variable.notes:
Your Google Analytics Property ID e.g. UA-xxxxxxxxx-x 
https://support.google.com/tagmanager/answer/9207621#ga_id

variable.name: BC_ LTR - GA - ID - By Host
BC_ CJS - Custom Task - Config
variable.notes:
customTask is part of the analytics.js (Google Universal Analytics) functionality. It allows for the manipulation of all GA tracking hits before they are sent to the Google Analytics server.

We use this feature to set common custom dimensions like the _ga cookie id (unique google analytics user identifier), session id, timestamp  and providing a basic level of PII (personal identifying information) redaction and prevention.

variable.name: BC_ CJS - Host And Debug
variable.notes: Combines the current website host name with GTM's flag for preview mode. The returned value can then be used to determine the difference between Prod/UAT environments events and when GTM is in testing mode. Very handy to prevent tracking from going into live accounts while testing.

variable.name: BC_ Const - Query - Accepted - Config
variable.notes:
Set the accepted query keys to be tracked as part of the page path. These values will appear in Google Analytics reports.
You can set multiple query keys by separating by  a comma "," e.g. q,search,page etc.
If you would like to accept all query string then only use "*" as the value.

variable.name: BC_ CJS - Click - Label
variable.notes: A custom script to improve the identification and labeling of html elements clicked on the website. Not all buttons on a website have click text e.g. images. This script provides a fallback for elements that do not have a value for the click text. It will search for known attributes and child elements for fall backs. This will not cover all cases but greatly improves the labeling for clicked elements.

variable.name: BC_ CJS - Click - URL - Type
variable.notes: This script will extract the current targeted click url hostname and compare it to the current website hostname. It will then determine if the clicked url is an internal,subdomain or external link.

variable.name: BC_ Const - Page Not Found - CSS - Config
BC_ Const - Page Not Found - Text - Config
BC_ CJS - Page - 404
variable.notes: This custom script attempts to identify the current page as a 404 error page. It will first review the document.title (browser page title) for expected matches from the configuration variables. If no match is found it will attempt to use the css selector configuration to read off the html targeted elements. This is used as part of a trigger condition to fire a 404 page load event.

variable.name: BC_ CJS - Form - Name
variable.notes: This script will evaluate the current form element, looking to provide a friendly reporting label. It will first attempt to use the name attribute, then a id, otherwise the forms parent html element classes.

variable.name: BC_ CJS - URL - Data
variable.notes: Return the combination of the current url query string (?) and anchor/fragment (#) if they exist in the current page url. Google Analytics will strip anchors and in some cases filter the query strings from reports. This variable is used to populate a custom dimension if this data needs to be preserved.

variable.notes: A custom script to check click text supplied by CJS variable and parse it for potential PII (email addresses), in which case it returns a 'redacted' string value.
